T-GrZESDKVaFkmjHUCpywQ.text: Prezzo in Mayfair is in a funky old buliding that looks like a cross between a church and a Tudor restaurant. The style is very unusual but it definitely makes it more unique than the other Prezzos. The food is a slightly upmarket pizza and pasta joint. The pizza is nice but the menu doesn't really change so if you eat there too often, you get sick of it. Also, if you take away then there is 2 for 1 on pizza. Update in June 2009Visited after a 8 month absence. Nothing much had changed, however the waitress arbitrarily decided to add a massive tip to the bill (without me knowing) and just handing me the credit card terminal to enter my PIN. She did not deserve a 25+% tip and I didn't notice it til too late. Not impressed

wP2oVCVkAND2lHpJRTc9FA.text: Great dinner spot! We are staying around the corner at The Park Lane so this is very convenient. Food is great, staff is friendly, and there's free wifi!

UQA73H0HcdsYQ6cfhrjT1g.text: The red sauce, which is on pastas and pizza is awful. The chicken was charred and dry. The high reviews for this chain are quite undeserved - this must come from the same people who rate a restaurant 4* for ambiance alone with no mention of the food!If you have ever eaten a meal cooked by an Italian, or in an Italian restaurant in the US, you have proper standards with which to rate an Italian restaurant. I can eat better Italian sauce from a jar in a US supermarket!HORRIBLE.

bhgG8XXtjISuH16mt7Swdw.text: Prezzois is part of the Jonathans pizza and pasta chain. This restaurant is based in Mayfair in Shepherds Market.I visited this restaurant with my sister and nieces and we were very impressed. The restaurant is a lovely building with wooden panelled walls. The staff were very friendly and I would definitely say they were child friendly!The food was very good and we felt that we were in a proper restaruant rather than a chain eaterie. The food is also great value - especially considering where you are in central London. Not too pricey at all.Definitely recommend it!

2xIMPHr3FFjNdFQgXHq0fw.text: Its all around UK. Very delicious food in different Italian way. We had 4 appetiser and poulognes vg pasta

photos.caption: Photo of Prezzo - London, United Kingdom. The vg pasta ( v delicious) and iced olive( not v nice)
Photo of Prezzo - London, United Kingdom. Italian natchos
Photo of Prezzo - London, United Kingdom. Garlic bread on hier way

NKOEuVgfaUGDWA309SoRFg.text: I'm a pizza lover and their pizza was near perfect. Good dough and cheese which is hard to find outside Italy. Only bad point is the small-ish menu. Slightly pricey, but definitely worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Prezzo - London, United Kingdom. The prosciutto (crudo) and funghi pizza. Very nice.

0O7X-FW-qMLynWOVe0hQDw.text: This is a great Prezzo's and very unique. The decor is really nice,resembles more like a pub, and definitely unlike all the other locations I have seen our visited. The food is very good as well and the sticky toffee pudding is a must for dessert so factor this in when you are ordering you food.

pQ0ywZn6tidBfZjBQGaWDw.text: Not knowing it was a chain, my husband and I wandered into Prezzo for dinner when we couldn't get a table at the tapas place down the street.  We ended up being very happy with the find.  We shared a pane con cipolla for an appetizer; the caramelized onions were perfection, and "enough to share" was definitely an understatement.  I had the king prawn risotto for my entree.  It was on the rich side, but delicious-- the leeks were a great addition, the saffron wasn't overdone, and the risotto was cooked exactly right.  He had lobster and crab tortellini and loved it. Again, the saffron sauce was great, and you can't go wrong with lobster and crab.The  wine menu was nice, and I liked that you could get varying size glasses. The servers were kind and helpful.  The art was a little odd, but the restaurant had a nice cozy vibe.  Overall this wasn't the most exciting Italian food I've ever had, but it might be the best chain Italian I've had.  I absolutely wouldn't complain if you told me I'd be taking a repeat visit to Prezzo.

zG_pDh_7rzYvt8wfYWjP6w.text: My family had two great meals at Prezzo. All the dishes were great!  Make sure you have the sticky toffee pudding. Outstanding.

gI_61gOFYoA1SFvUKYZncg.text: I've eaten here twice in the week I spent in London. The food is delicious! I had the Wild Mushroom Risotto both times because it was very good and filling, as well as the hazelnut chocolate cake and the Nutella banana mini calzone for dessert. The staff is also very polite and very keen on knowing when they are needed and when they are not. I was very pleased with my meals. Also, although they don't official have free wifi, I was able to connect to an open network while there without issue.

DookOfmXb15SefXOoy88tQ.text: + One of the few reasonably priced restaurants in Mayfair ££ - Check!+ Service, attentive, friendly staff - Check!+ Warm tasty Garlic bread with Mozz - Check!+ Salads - ehh...+ Spaghetti, Lasagna, Fusilli, pizzas - Check!!!!+ Nutella, banana, vanilla bean mini calzones - Check & Check!+ free glass of Prosecco for some anniversary they had - Score!

l5V79CM4DwluEJytTxvm8w.text: Quaint Italian restaurant. Surprisingly good food under $50 per person in fancy Mayfair area. Try the olives, fried mozzarella, rocket greens, chicken pasta and pizzas. Slow but nice service.

G00fE9IjQBu5nnmrjTV28A.text: Found this place while walking around looking for food. Everything on the menu sounds delicious, I had the salmon avocado salad it was delicious and the desserts are even better. We like it so much we went 2 nights in a row for dinner. And they have wifi which helps if your planning other activities while having dinner

FJd_ZfHOCsyBp9OcOBst1A.text: for an unassuming, casual Italian restaurant ... outstanding! the food was simple and delicious. the only thing better was the service. extremely friendly and attentive.very surprised and impressed. if I'm in the area again, I'll be back.

zGT7-En9E9i38DihwEDUyw.text: After reading the reviews of the other Prezzo Restaurants, we decided to try the branch in Mayfair.  Its big advantage is that it is right around the corner from our hotel, the Park Lane Hotel.  Prezzo is basically a high end pizza and pasta place.  We both had salads for starters.  My Cesar salad was very nice, nothing great but reasonable.  I wish I had ordered the mixed salad my wife had.  It was a lovely selection of assorted fresh vegetable, all nicely prepared, pieces of veg were not too small but perfect for eating size.  For mains, my wife had a very good traditional lasagna while I had the Meatball al Forno.  Rigatoni, mushrooms and meatballs in a tomato sauce covered with cheeses and baked.  Both were very large portions and well prepared and served.Some of the other reviews have complained about the service.  Ours was prompt and polite.  There when you wanted her and not hovering.Would definitely go back if the opportunity presents.

CqN5HgBYk4pZyxrNwwAwGQ.text: Poor service, and well below average food    The Bruschetta was a pizza crust with tomatoes, very disappointing.

Nh1Jq4hJHK_DgZu9bI2GDw.text: Prezzo is a laid back casual environment, perfect for unwinding after a long day of work.  I was staying at the hotel right around the corner so going here was driven mostly by convenience.Had a pizza and sticky toffee pudding.  The pizza was just how I like it: thin, crispy, and not overly-loaded up on cheese.  The sticky toffee pudding was ok, nothing spectacular.The food was good and the price was right too.

9QXxILl9Q223UWOf6uReqA.text: This site was rated 4 stars and 2 pounds for price.We asked the waitress what were the best things on the menu. That is what we ordered and the food was just so-so. But the prices were better than we thought they would be.We also ordered garlic bread and Sticky Toffee Pudding. I would give the Garlic Bread a 1 star - could be the worse I ever had, but the Sticky Toffee Pudding was 4 star worthy.The service was excellent. But then again there were not many people in the restaurant.

UmApPDf01mKJpH7GiaV8Rg.text: We ate here 4 days in a row and have found the food to be very tasty from the fresh garlic bread to the Lasagna to the fusilli gorgonzola. This must be a franchise restaurant because it is run by a very nice lady and her daughters help to wait tables

gTicLSgtRKX7MXMjUGZQ8g.text: I stopped by for dinner on my first night in London since the restaurant was around the corner from my hotel. When I walks up I was told they were closed and were not seating anyone.  The next I came back and was very pleased with my meal.  The hostess was very friendly and she and the server were extremely attentive.  Good location and a good value.

igJrOrUaTH-KbNT4zpJmbQ.text: Right around the corner from the Intercontinental, Hilton and Sheraton Park Lane. Solid if uninspiring food at lower-than-average prices for a sit-down meal in London. Chicken marsala was exceptional. Recommended for families with kids.

W6Of9KjOQe7er-d-F7OCCg.text: A very nice place. The pizza was huge and the pasta was delicious. The service was fast and kind. Recommended.

NtFUIkvV-OL2iUpuavBl2g.text: A typical Prezzo in a great location, right off Berkeley Square, which makes it a great place to have a business meeting. It is an entire building on a very quiet street. So while the ground floor area can get busy the top floor is always very relaxed and empty, but with good service nonetheless. I would advise to be careful with the pasta dishes as they are not prepared per order, but seem to be microwaved and therefore the food on the centre of the plate can be quite cold. I would opt for a pizza or a salad instead :)

68jrDdUXf8ntA1BvjLQkQw.text: Let's start with what I like... I like the both the interior and the exterior design of this particular Prezzo, it somehow looks like a old barn house, but with a lot of paintings hanging around. I like the atmosphere created by the dim lighting and candles, with that, you tend to relax and dip yourselves inside the comfortable eating mood. However, I would say the food isn't too great, particular for the Spaghetti Carbonara, the cause was too thick and greasy plus the ham on top was too hard and too dry and too salty. Risotto was nice but not taste like genuine Italian cuisine, I understand hat's always the case for chain restaurant, as they need to alter to suit locals and the market.

-EbpqcQ7nrCNVWgMjCBGxg.text: Great Italian restaurant! One of the best pizzas in London and very nice selection of deserts.

VW3E55i1lkI_fSdAysnLJA.text: Located behind Nobu at Hyde Park, we were expecting something better than most restaurants we have been patronizing in London.  Unfortunately, that was not the case.  We arrived about 15 minutes late, and the host was not too happy about that, which is fine since we were the ones who were tardy.  Nonetheless, we were seated within minutes.  Once we sat down though, we waited for about 10 minutes before we were asked to place our order.  Now, this may be fine by London's standards, but this is supposed to be a reputable establishment in a classy neighborhood.  Can we make a little effort please? We placed our orders and our drinks arrive at their leisure.  I guess the dishwasher felt the same way because my wine glass was dirty on the rim.  I let it go but in hindsight, that was pretty gross. Our food was mediocre; really nothing to write home about.  Not sure how it got a 4 stars average on Yelp.  Pizza, spaghetti & meatball were uninspiring.  The whole experience was just meh and I don't recommend this restaurant.

VxP7jMGOUDYY9eLopFeUGQ.text: Stumbled upon this place while on our way to an event in Hyde Park, would happily return if we're ever in the area.  Service was slightly lacking, but it's a smaller place and they had a large work Xmas party that was keeping the servers very busy.  Food and wine were excellent, reasonably priced, and arrived at our table much quicker than expected.  Atmosphere was pleasant and we didn't know this was a chain until the wife was looking something up online after the meal.  Had a bit of trouble trying to use their handheld card reader to pay the bill, but it finally worked after about 7 tries.  4 stars.  Would return

photos.caption: Photo of Prezzo - London, United Kingdom. Excellent Calzone !

Z8bwAQNUMPWVHEC50UEmJw.text: We got special pizza with mozzarella and tomatoes. We also had an order of ravioli. Both were very good. I really liked my pizza crust. My only problem is that it got soggy because of the tomatoes. I would try a different one next time. Ravioli were really good and the service was great. The decor inside is pretty cool.

photos.caption: Photo of Prezzo - London, United Kingdom. Inside the restaurant
Photo of Prezzo - London, United Kingdom. Inside
Photo of Prezzo - London, United Kingdom. Pizza

v7jNn-tWsywTbn0twu2RCg.text: Typical London customer service.(i.e. None) Only one server for the whole place. He sits us, then we wait over 8 min for him to come back to ask if we're ready to order. Didn't even ask for a drink order or bring water. We put in our entire order, then he proceeds to go and bus a few tables. Takes another 8 min just to get drinks. Wine glass came with a sticky substance on the rim. At this point, we're praying that the food will stand up to the high review standard. Nope. Spaghetti and Giant Meatballs - not even sauce to coat the parts, spaghetti not al dente, meatballs dry (though tasty). Pizza tri gusti - uncut (Fine, I'll do the work. But don't give me a dull pizza cutter.), very dry, no sauce, not tasty. Hugely disappointed in the pizza and anyone that says it's delicious has never been to the US, or Italy for that matter.The only reason it's not one star is because it's a nice place, cute building, food wasn't inedible (just not good). 1.5 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Prezzo - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Prezzo - London, United Kingdom

KLGx15rEoubCp7UsH9sm_A.text: We stopped here for a quick lunch. The food was very good. We ordered the Tropicana pizza (prosciutto, pineapple, mushrooms, etc). I think the person we spoke to was the manager but he was a nice guy and made the short experience wonderful. (With love from California/Virginia :-) )

orr8CyOKQzUmAurynFod4A.text: Very very good after a long day of sightseeing. We had the chicken asparagus risotto as well as one of the thin crust pizzas and they were both excellent. Don't forget the truffle infused French fries as they are not to be missed. We will be back next time we are in London.

3zCICRgfyEdFIioWHNtCeg.text: This restaurant was delicious. The Caesar salad was great, the mushroom risotto was hot with fresh greens, and the truffle fries were yummy. A healthy pour of wine is just the cherry on top. They were also very accommodating...allowing us to order a large pizza after the kitchen had closed. Highly recommend.

4-xhM-NJcGzEHqcWvU_yQA.text: Came here based on the reviews. We were seated at a table tucked away in a corner. Unfortunately, out of sight also meant out of mind. The waitress had a limited knowledge of English and could not grasp the idea of water with a slice of lemon. Rather, we were given some sort of flavors soda which she argued was in fact water. We ordered the light goat cheese and Auvergne pizza along with the penne arrabiatta. Both were tasty. No one ever approached us to check on the quality of the food or to top up our water glasses. Go for a quick bite and know that service will require that you are visible.

Fm7SNswCNjYSxFKkSBmkrg.text: Cute place but food is not great. Had the worse pizza I've eaten in a very long timeL and the beet salad was just ok.  If you just drinking it's a nice place.

Yfxu4t58wyId_h2q-fHZTw.text: Kids gave it 5, but the wife and I were a 3 and a bit...so gone for 4 stars. The VIPizza is the one to order, lovely Flatbread and beautifully crispy. Bizarre ambience for an Italian... "Tudor Italian".

GaYK8pG4gGbf5db_J9lxYw.text: I was in London for a business trip and came here as the Fish & Chip place next door was packed and I was starving.  I really wanted to like this place that seems to be somewhat cute and quaint, but I'm sorry to say the food is ever SO bland and the noise level was off the chart!!  I ordered the butternut squash soup as a starter and it was pretty lumpy.  Perhaps I've been spoiled with good, smooth tasty butternut squash soup that I couldn't fully appreciate a lumpy, gooey mess??!  My main course I ordered the pappardelle with mushroom.  This dish was so bland and runny that I couldn't finish it.  There was just no flavor to the dish at all :-( I gave it 2* because the staff was pleasant, otherwise I would've only given 1*.

pBx1hDcabwEZ7KaNGs052g.text: Mediocre Italian food. Very bad frozen calamari. Tasteless pasta with Gorgonzola sauce with chicken and broccoli and pancetta. However, two pieces of broccoli and no chicken. Asked for the pasta al dente - clearly they don't have a clue. It is a chain I've read - but the reviews were good and around the corner from my hotel.

bsVAwP0tXCivx9BB2i4JBw.text: For a chain Italian eatery, this particular Prezzo in Mayfair was wonderfully convenient to our Piccadilly hotel and provided a nice atmosphere and good service after a full day traveling from overseas.  The price point is fair and the food was well received from all of our family from grandparents to teenagers.  Restaurant for a special occasion?  Probably not.  But for a good price and ambiance and convenience, we will dine here again when in London.

U8uPnuHW5DD5-4wo3a92lA.text: They have a very good menu with many tasty-sounding dishes. Took me some time to even decide what I'm goong to eat. ;) I ended up ordering the Vesuvio pizza, V.I.Pizza style. Quite delicious. All ingredients seem to be fresh.The staff was friendly and the food got prepared pretty fast - but maybe that's just due to the fact that I was there in the afternoon when it was quite empty.

photos.caption: Photo of Prezzo - London, United Kingdom. Vesuvio, V.I.Pizza style

WlD2cpn7U_gDH2grTa-WjQ.text: Local feel, very good food and great eats and drinks for the price! Any dish with the prawn is a go to.  I would definitely say on the lower side of ££ compared to the rest of this neighborhood.

YMahFBryN5d0gZO_T8PSEA.text: While in London found this gem around the corner from our hotel.  The food was excellent.  I had the calzone and my girlfriend has pasta.  I recommend the tiramisu for desert.  Our waitress Linda was absolutely fantastic.

xTnWv0VCW635U0_q3rYI5Q.text: My coworker came here not realizing it was a chain restaurant and we really enjoyed the meal. We had pizzas and some appetizers and they food was all good and had plenty of flavor. The drinks were good and the service was adequate. If I was in a pinch I would go back here again.

CyYjUOGj3hbs15lXUpvttg.text: We dined at Prezzo three times during our trip to London last week - one lunch and two dinners.  The restaurant was a short walk from our hotel and we were in search of 'child friendly' places to eat.  Prezzo was accommodating with our 15 month old son, with high chairs readily available, crayons for entertainment, and a place for us to leave our stroller inside while we ate.  The food was quite good and reasonably priced - we didn't realize this was a chain until after our first meal.  They offer two options for children's meals, which was appreciated - one for 'little' children and one for older.  Our little guy enjoyed his garlic bread with cheese, pizza/pasta, and ice cream very much.  My husband had a calzone, a pizza, and the lasagna during our visits, all were well prepared and promptly delivered (something we appreciated with a little guy, dining time is limited to about 45 minutes from seating to exit!).  I enjoyed the chicken fungi, chicken milanese, and a delicious spinach salad with chicken and goat cheese.  We would absolutely dine here again and send our thanks to the restaurant for accommodating us on our holiday!

u3wBrWytrmT1IDHRlCo00g.text: My friend and I came in here on our way through to Covent Garden because we had £40 worth of Tesco clubcard vouchers to spend. I have never actually eaten at a Prezzo without using these vouchers because they're so damn good!! Because I've been to ths chain so many times I'm familiar with their menu but it's good that they always change it up. It took us forever to decide what to choose as it all sounded amazing. In the end we opted for some olives and the grilled goats cheese and deep-fried mozarella for starters. I then had the chicken and asparagus risotto which was really creamy, garlicy and an all round tasty dish. My friend went for a spicy sausage pizza that neither of us could pronounce but that was apparently also very tasty. The service was okay, but not really anything to report on. The actual restaurant was tiny inside but with nice decor. You'd expect it to be bigger for picadilly circus as lots of people were having to wait for tables towards the end. For all of this food, we only had to pay for the £15 bottle of wine which wasn't to be sneezed at. I'd highly recommend the Tesco clubcard vouchers (not that this is a review for Tesco...)
